definition.text: Use F11 to zoom in to the code once it stops at the breaking point, and use F5 to take it step by step forward.

translations.text: Use F11 to zoom in to the code once it stops at the breaking point, and use F5 to take it step by step forward.

paragraphs.text: Ssssh, be quiet... wait for it...
As soon as the data for your indicator is being processed, your IDE will pause the process at the break point we set earlier...
... allowing you to zoom in to the details what's really going on.
Keep an eye out for when your Breaking point changes from a dot to an arrow.
Use F11 to zoom into the code and F5 to step forward.
Keep stepping forward to follow the flow of data.
Monitor what's going on in the code, and hover over your variables to check what values they get.
Tip: In cases where the values turn to "NaN" or stays "undefined" without a logical reason - There's a point to raise doubt.
